intro: Astragalus garmashubensis, commonly known as the Garmashuben milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. It plays a role in soil stabilization and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its scientific study contributes to understanding plant adaptations in harsh environments.
